com.zenon.sdk.core

Class ConnectionManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.zenon.sdk.core.EventDispatcher
      • com.zenon.sdk.core.ConnectionManager

  • public class ConnectionManager
extends com.zenon.sdk.core.EventDispatcher
    This class controls the login/logout signaling and session initiation, maintenance and termination
    Version:
    ZenonSDKv1.0
    Author:
    Pankaj Sharma (pankajs@requestec.com)

      • httpGetConnection

        public static java.lang.String[] httpGetConnection(java.lang.String URL)
        API to do an HTTP GET request
        Parameters:
        URL - url for HTTP GET request
        Returns:
        A String Array of the strings created from received response broken by '\n'

      • dispatchEvent

        public static void dispatchEvent(int eventCode,
                 java.lang.Object data,
                 Context context)
        This API provides a capability to the third party Application for broadcasting an event. The Events are defined in the EventDispatcher
        Parameters:
        eventCode - Integer code of Event to be broadcasted
        data - Object Data to be sent along with the event. This should either be a serializable or parcelable object or a StringArray.
        context - This is the Activity or Service context currently being used

      • addListener

        public static void addListener(Context context,
               BroadcastReceiver reciever,
               java.lang.String event)
        This API provides a capability to the third party Application for registering as an Event Listener for a broadcast event. The Events are defined in the EventDispatcher
        Parameters:
        context - This is the Activity or Service context currently being used
        reciever - BroadCast Receiver Handler for handling specific events
        event - String code of Event to be broadcasted

      • removeListener

        public static void removeListener(Context context,
                  BroadcastReceiver reciever)
        This API provides a capability to the third party Application to remove a registered Event Listener for a broadcast event. The Events are defined in the EventDispatcher
        Parameters:
        context - This is the Activity or Service context currently being used
        reciever - BroadCast Receiver Handler for handling specific events

      • loginToServer

        public static void loginToServer(java.lang.String server,
                 java.lang.String username,
                 java.lang.String password,
                 Context context)
        Method responsible for logging into the CLS and dispatching appropriate events to the event manager. The event manager will will then use the event dispatcher to further "bubble up" the events.
        Parameters:
        server - Web address of the Central Logging Server
        username - UserName of the user logging in
        password - Password of the user logging in
        context - Context of the current Activity or Service
